title: Object alphabets
content:
Letters made from objects. Feel free to contribute.

" [Bookshelf font](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730151019/http:/www.amandinealessandra.com/cumulus/2008/11/11/book-as-a-block-block-as-a-type-booksetting/)"
author: Christopher Dean

comments.content:
Compilation of 22 object typefaces - worth a look if you're into this kind of thing.  
 [http://www.reubenmiller.typepad.com/my\_weblog/2008/09/21-unexpected-a.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730151019/http:/www.reubenmiller.typepad.com/my_weblog/2008/09/21-unexpected-a.html "http://www.reubenmiller.typepad.com/my\_weblog/2008/09/21-unexpected-a.html")
I agree. I like the trucks too.

Weird coincidence but [here's one](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730151019/http:/www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-1197898/Pictured-The-Google-Earth-alphabet-Britains-hedgerows-roads-buildings.html) that appeared in the Daily Mail this very morning. It's like they knew you were looking!

Here is a blog featuring a few more. Some of them were already seen in the compilation posted by madefresh, but there are a few new ones too.  
 [http://www.holster.co.uk/blog/alphabets-with-character](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730151019/http:/www.holster.co.uk/blog/alphabets-with-character)

Made from bodies by Anthon Beeke in 1970 and apparantly recently plagiarized by someone:

[http://www.beeke.nl/aB\_alphabet\_02.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730151019/http:/www.beeke.nl/aB_alphabet_02.html "http://www.beeke.nl/aB\_alphabet\_02.html")  
 [http://www.beeke.nl/aB\_alphabet\_01.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730151019/http:/www.beeke.nl/aB_alphabet_01.html "http://www.beeke.nl/aB\_alphabet\_01.html")

. . .  
Bert Vanderveen BNO

[http://haha.nu/files/uploads/HLIC/farm3.static.flickr.com/2474/355839227...](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730151019/http:/haha.nu/files/uploads/HLIC/farm3.static.flickr.com/2474/3558392275_8fa7394391_o.jpg "http://haha.nu/files/uploads/HLIC/farm3.static.flickr.com/2474/3558392275\_8fa7394391\_o.jpg")  
For the entire alphabet, check out [http://www.thijsverbeek.nl/index5.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730151019/http:/www.thijsverbeek.nl/index5.html "http://www.thijsverbeek.nl/index5.html")
